Package com.logdyn

Class CommandDelegator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.logdyn.CommandDelegator

  • public class CommandDelegator
extends java.lang.Object
    Controls the delegation of commands to their respective executor classes. Provides the ability to listen for the execution of commands.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getINSTANCE

        public static CommandDelegator getINSTANCE​()

      • subscribe

        public <C extends Command> boolean subscribe​(Executor<C> executor,
                                             java.lang.Class<C> clazz)
        Subscribes an executor to listen for and execute any commands that are an instance of the specified class, or any sub-classes
        Type Parameters:
        C - The type of the command the executor will handle
        Parameters:
        executor - The executor for the command or sub-classes of the command
        clazz - The class of the command
        Returns:
        Returns true if the executor is successfully subscribed, returns false if the an executor of the class or a parent class is already subscribed

      • unsubscribe

        public <C extends Command> boolean unsubscribe​(Executor<C> executor)
        Unsubscribes the executor from the delegator
        Type Parameters:
        C - The type of the command the executor handles
        Parameters:
        executor - The executor to unsubscribe
        Returns:
        Returns true if the executor is found and removed, returns false if it is not found

      • publish

        public void publish​(Command command)
             throws ExecutionException
        Publishes command to the most generic subscribed executor. Always records for undo, see publish(Command, boolean)
        Parameters:
        command - The command to execute
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if the command does not execute successfully
        NoSuchExecutorException - if there is no registered Executor for the given Command

      • publish

        public void publish​(Command command,
                    boolean record)
             throws ExecutionException
        Publishes command to the most generic subscribed executor for that command, with the option of recording for undo
        Parameters:
        command - The command to publish and execute
        record - whether or not to add the command to the stack, enabling undo/redo
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if the command does not execute successfully
        NoSuchExecutorException - if there is no registered Executor for the given Command

      • undo

        public void undo​()
          throws ExecutionException
        Call unexecute command on executor on previous command Only works if both command and executor are undoable
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there is no Command to be undone
        ExecutionException - if undo does not execute successfully
        NoSuchExecutorException - if there is no registered Executor for the Command to be undone

      • undo

        public void undo​(int count)
          throws ExecutionException
        Throws:
        ExecutionException

      • redo

        public void redo​()
          throws ExecutionException
        Call reexecute command on executor on previous command Only works if both command and executor are redoable
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there is no Command to be redone
        ExecutionException - if redo does not execute successfully
        NoSuchExecutorException - if there is no registered Executor for the Command to be redone

      • redo

        public void redo​(int count)
          throws ExecutionException
        Throws:
        ExecutionException

      • canUndo

        public boolean canUndo​()
        Returns:
        true if there is a command that can be undone

      • canRedo

        public boolean canRedo​()
        Returns:
        true if there is a command that can be redone

      • getUndoName

        public java.lang.String getUndoName​()
        Returns:
        the name of the command that would be the result of calling the undo() method, returns null if no command can be undone

      • getExecutionRecords

        public java.util.SortedSet<com.logdyn.ExecutionRecord> getExecutionRecords​(int count)
        Gets the X most recent records where x is the value of count parameter.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of ExecutionRecords to return
        Returns:
        a new SortedSet containing the requested records
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if count is less than 0

      • addListener

        public boolean addListener​(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Registers an invalidation listener, listener is invalidated when a command is executed, unexecuted, or reexecuted
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to register
        Returns:
        true (as specified by Collection.add(E))
